About Me

A few things about me...

BIO

I am a Software Engineer turned Pastor. Well, maybe it's better put this way; I am a Pastor who dabbled into Software Engineering for a bit and is now an interesting amalgamation of both. I got my Bachelor's from Uniersity of Oklahoma, Norman Oklahoma and my Master's from Cornell University, Ithaca New York. For many years, I travelled the US and Canada for my business as a Business Intelligence Consultant. At the end of 2017, I closed shop on that aspect of my life and moved squarely into the work of ministry. I love organizing women's conferences which I do every year in Chicago, London and Lagos. I am a minister at KingsWord International Church - Chicago. My 9 to 5 is as Executive Vive President of KingsWord Everywhere where I map out strategy for growth in all our activities as a ministry.

Mother and Wife

My passion. My heart. My first ministry

I have two lovely children. They are growing so fast. They are not so little anymore. My first born is Tolu. he calls himself Kayson( his daddy is Kay for short. So, 'Kayson'. Kay's son. Get it?). He is currently in residential high school and comes home most weekends. My daughter's name is Temi( we are still looking for a good nickname for her because 'MayDaughter' doesn't sound cute). She is all kinds of creative. She is into so many things and good at most of them. I am married to Dr Kay Ijisesan. He used to be Pastor Kay but he changed his name when he started traveling so much. That is what an Apostle does. You can hop on over to his page to find out more about him.

Teacher

I can describe a boring pole in 6 different ways...

A teacher's job is to describe things in a simple way so people get it. My job is done when people see the light. I am a teacher by calling. I try to use practical, everyday examples to drive my message home. I love teaching God's Word. I teach at the KingsWord Women's Conferences in Chicago, London and Lagos every year. That means I travel to Europe and Africa on an annual basis. I have also taught in The Philippines, Asia. I hope to start a regular women's meeting in Asia soon. That is a big vision for me. I teach at my local church, KingsWord International Church, Chicago when my husband is traveling. I travel to other KingsWord churches to teach as well.

Career Resources

Heavenly Resources for the Workplace

Several years ago, I wrote a book titled, 'Wisdom for the Workplace'. In the book, I put down different things that the Lord hah showed me over the years about how believers can excel in the Marketplace. I worked in the secular arena for about 18 years. In that space of time, I worked as an employee and as a business owner. I travelled extensively and worked with people all over the United States and Canada. I had the opportunity to observe a lot of things in the workplace. I also got the opportunity to see how God's Word can be applied at the workplace to make sure a believe functions optimally in that world. I love to share these tips in career meetings and conferences. I have not done a lot of them recently but those are meetings I hope to organize more of in the future.
